content.2: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters
content.3: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
content.4: I also could speak as ye
content.6: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and
content.7: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
content.8: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles,
content.10: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
content.11: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
content.12: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken
content.13: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
content.14: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.
content.15: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
content.16: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids
content.18: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
content.21: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man
content.22: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way
